intro: Mesembryanthemum constrictum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid environments.
